title: [ICE] on Nightly 2018-11-09 with simple u128 shift

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This code:

```
fn main() {
    let _ = 1u128 >> 1;
}
```

Compiling with just:

`rustc test.rs`

With the last nightly:

```
rustc 1.32.0-nightly (36a50c29f 2018-11-09)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 36a50c29f6c5c386fba6ab685818755ac55152e5
commit-date: 2018-11-09
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.32.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0
```

Gives:

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: "read_option: expected 0 for None or 1 for Some"', libcore\result.rs:1009:5
stack backtrace:
   0: mingw_set_invalid_parameter_handler
```
